question: What ___ your name?
She ___ to school every day.
I ___ a student last year.
They ___ in the park when it started to rain.
If I ___ you, I would study harder.
This is ___ book I have ever read.
She ___ her homework yet.
I ___ to the party if I finish my work on time.
The teacher asked us ___ quiet.
By the time we arrived, the movie ___.
I don’t mind ___ early in the morning.
There isn’t ___ milk in the fridge.
This book ___ to me by my friend.
You ___ smoke here; it’s prohibited.
I wish I ___ speak English fluently.
The room ___ cleaned every day.
She asked me where ___.
I ___ to the gym three times a week.
If he ___ earlier, he wouldn’t have missed the bus.
The more you practice, ___ you will become.
I’m very ___ because I passed my exam!
Can you ___ the TV? It’s too loud.
The opposite of “big” is ___.
I need to ___ a phone call to my friend.
This restaurant is very ___; we should book a table.
She is very ___ about her new job.
I’m looking for my keys. Have you ___ them?
The meeting was ___ because the manager was sick.
This book is so ___ that I can’t stop reading it.
He speaks English very ___.
I’m feeling a bit ___; I think I need to see a doctor.
Can you ___ me some money until tomorrow?
This task is very ___; I need more time to complete it.
The ___ of the company made an important announcement.
I’m not sure, but I think we should ___ the instructions again.

Anna is a 20-year-old student from Tashkent. She studies English at a local university and dreams of becoming a translator. Every morning, she wakes up at 7 a.m., has breakfast, and takes a bus to her classes. In her free time, she enjoys reading books and watching English movies to improve her language skills. Last summer, she traveled to London with her family and visited many famous places, like Big Ben and the British Museum. She hopes to return one day to study abroad. 

 Where is Anna from?

Conversation: A man says, “I’m going to the supermarket. Do you need anything?” The woman replies, “Yes, please buy some milk and bread.” 

What does the woman ask the man to buy?

Announcement: “Attention, passengers. The train to Bukhara will leave from platform 3 in 10 minutes.” 

Where is the train going?

Conversation: A student asks, “When is the homework due?” The teacher replies, “It’s due on Friday.”

When is the homework due?

When is the museum closed?

Conversation: A woman says, “I love this restaurant. The food is delicious, and the service is great!”

What does the woman think about the restaurant?
options: She likes the food and service.
She thinks the service is bad.
